comment: Not a very good teacher. You basically have to teach yourself. If you can do math, take her. You'll only have to show up on test days. But if you need someone to actually teach you, then go somewhere else.
Unhelpful, treats students like they are dumb, quiz every class period that cannot be made up even for medical reasons, never smiles

This professor means well, I'm sure. However, she DOES NOT teach. She merely flips through the powerpoints saying "you should already this". And moving on incredibly quick. I always took the daily quiz (a huge plus), the left to look at the powerpoints at home.

She is very nice! She gives a homework quiz every class at the very beginning. You are free to leave after, but if you're not good at math, I suggest you sit in the front and stay the whole class time.  The tests are the exact same as the practice tests so I suggest you do them. This class is very easy if you put in effort.

Ms. Frankel is very sweet.  She gives daily quizzes, which are open note and open book.  Be sure to do the homework and print the powerpoints.  Tests are fair and can be a little tricky if you don't study.  If you do the homework and do well on the daily quizzes, you should be fine.  I'm not a math person, but I would recommend this professor.

Teaches as if she doesn't want to be there. Students constantly talked while she lectured. Seemed intimidated to ask students to be quiet while she lectured. Her favorite quote while lecturing, "you should already know this"

Very nice, attendence is mandatory because she gives daily quizzes. Class is easy, if you pay attention - will help you, you just have to show that you are interested enough in learning. Teaches at a fast past, test are just like the review so always do your review!

Enjoyed having her as a professor - would highly recommend. Attendance, daily quizzes, and extra credit all give you extra opportunities to do well!  Biggest recommendation would be to go to class and do the homework problems that she provides!

She gave use EVERY opportunity to do well... extra points on quizzes and tests.  I liked her approach with leaving the homework assignments up to you to do.  She went over ALL the work in the class and was available after class for further review. Very fair teacher.

She is a good and fair teacher. Daily quizzes with extra credit. Section 1 is pretty tough due to the amount of material covered, but once you get over that hump the rest of the class is a breeze. Just make sure to show up for every class, do the daily homework, do the practice tests, assigned chapter summary questions and you should do fine.

I loved professor Frankel. She gives you study guides if you attend class and has practice tests on gaview. She gives near daily open note/book homework quizes, which you can get extra credit on.  All of her tests have extra credit on them. If you study, and attend class regularly you should be fine. Her tests are kind of hard, but passable.
Awesome person!  But not the best when it comes to teaching.  Gives lots of extra credit, but the tests seem out of the blue even if you did good on quizzes.

VERY nice person, but the majority of her exercises are WORD PROBLEMS, so if you don't like them consider taking someone else. If you show you're trying, she will help you, but her class is far from an easy A. Short class time. Come to class anyway - partial and extra credit chances everyday are her biggest pros, besides her personality of course.

Mrs. Frankel is super sweet once you get to know her. She is a great person, but not the best teacher. She doesn't give enough examples. If you go out of your way she will help. Lots of partial credit which is a big help. If she could come up w/ examples on her own she would be better because she is great at simplifying math. TONS of word problems!
I took this class in the summer and it went really FAST.  Professor was helpful and nice, but you need to ask questions.  Bonus opportunity every day and on every test.

I took this class in the summer and it went really FAST.  Professor was helpful, and nice, but you need to ask the questions.  Homework quizzes helped boost my grade.  Bonus opportunity every day, and on every test.

This class was a struggle! I earned a B but it wasnt easy. I endured a lot of stress. If Math isn't your strength then DON'T take this class! Professor is nice & gives partial credit on test/quizzes. The entire class is WORD PROBLEMS!She teaches from PPT & we NEVER ever stayed in class for the entire 1hr & 15min. Professor NOT recommended!
You can build up  your score with extra credit every day you come to class A+ Class for serious students

This class is fun If you come to class always.Ask question on time if you don't understand any thing. We have names and phone numbers of all the students that you can always call for help.I will be taking my finals on 12/09/09 and I am sure of "A" because we are going to be tested on what we studied in the class.Lazy students dislike her.

She is a hardworking soon to be mother of two. Everyone i sat next to complained and hated her but for the first time in my life I got an A+ in a math class. If you listen in class, *do your homework* and take the online practice test you will do amazing in this class. Hw quiz every day (EASY), three tests and a final. She is a good math teacher.

OMG!!!PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS she is the worst teacher I have ever had some teachers teach cause they love it and somce cause they need extra money and this is exactly her...why would kennesaw hire her?!?!? she is not helpful at all if you want to maintain a good GPA DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER...YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! she is awful! Always in a bad/depressed mood and the homework, notes we take, and quizzes that we have EVERYday have nothing to do with each other! It's not that it's that hard, she's jsut an awful teacher-might as well teach yourself.

DO YOUR HOMEWORK. She teaches from a powerpoint but will go over examples from the text book. She gives homework quizzes and its basically what you went over in class. She is fair grader (gives partial credit on tests-understand the concept but didnt get the answer). Make sure you have a solid understanding of algebra before you take this class.

This teacher is helpful in breaking down each section before the quiz each day ans steps u through it. HOWEVER - she will put up a powerpoint and explain a basic concept, then the homework is NOTHING LIKE it.  I have to spend HOURS in the math lab to get it, so I'm not really learning it from her, but I like the way she reviews b4 tests

Attention Dr. Papp! Fire this woman! Do not take her class! I repeat, Do not take her class! I'm curious how she got a job teaching at the college level. Students were dropping this class like crazy. By the end of the semester, only the geeks and nerds were left.

If you cannot teach math to yourself, don't take this class. If you can, then take it. We are never in class for more than 45 minutes except for tests. She doesn't answer questions...she wouldn't even answer questions for my group project. She is not lenient with grades/points at all. Powerpoint are kinda confusing.

I took her spring 2009 and I wish I would have known about this website before I signed up. I ended up dropping her class she was so horriable. PLEASE FOR YOUR OWN G.P.A. DONT TAKE HER CLASS,CONSIDER YOURSELF WARNED!

Needs to be fired. That pretty much sums it up. Without a doubt the worst teacher at Kennesaw State University, HANDS DOWN! Heed this warning: Do not, under any  circumstance (unless you are a Math genius) get her as a teacher. You will fail or have to drop the class. Consider yourself warned.

worse prof so far at ksu.  you ask for help and she looks at you like your an idiot.  one person asked advice on how to do better in class...her response was "try harder".  she does a 5 min powerpoint and that is her "teaching" the lesson

Do not take this class unless you intend to teach yourself. This class is only for people who don't need any instruction. She puts homework assignments on the board, you check them yourself and then class is over. She says she doesn't care if you even come to class except to take tests. Horrible!!! Don't pay for this!

Possibly the worst teacher in KSU history. If you have to take this class, show up the first day to get the syllabus and then ONLY on test days. You might as well just study on your own because you will learn absolutly nothing by going to this class. The class had to constantly correct HER mistakes! OH THE HUMANITY! I want my money back!

She does not teach. She goes over the homework and briefly the next class work and homework. She does not really explain, step by step how to solve or learn how to solve the problems. I am awful in math and need a good teacher. She is nice and understanding but not a good teacher to adults who have not had math in a while.

Of all the teachers I've ever had in my life, Stacey Frankel is by far the worst. She hasn't a CLUE what she is doing. She does not and can not teach. It's impossible to learn from her, not to mention the tests are 10 times as hard as any work you do in the class. She's only part time at ksu and is a kindergarden teacher the rest of the time.
